sentences.en: Be courteous -- even when people are most discourteous to you.
sentences.cn: 要有礼貌 ─ ─即使当别人对你最不礼貌的时候.

sentences.en: Discourteous are also errors included in business letter - writing.
sentences.cn: 失礼也是商业信件写作中的错误.

sentences.en: Do not arrive tardy, can let superior had waited again long and discourteous.
sentences.cn: 迟迟不到, 则又会让上级等候过久而失礼.

sentences.en: I was offended by his discourteous reply.
sentences.cn: 他无礼的回答使我很生气.

sentences.en: It was discourteous of you to arrive late.
It would be discourteous to ignore his request.
sentences.cn: 忽略他的要求很不礼貌.

sentences.en: Lateness is discourteous to your classmates and to your professor.
sentences.cn: 迟到是对你同学和教授的不尊敬.

sentences.en: Mr Kingman's performance was described by committee members as " dozy " and " discourteous "
sentences.cn: 委员会成员将Kingman的工作表现描述为 “ 昏昏欲睡 ” “ 失礼鲁莽 ”

sentences.en: Staff are often discourteous and sometimes downright rude.
sentences.cn: 职员常常态度很不礼貌，有时候极其蛮横。

sentences.en: The above telephone conversation is not only discourteous, but also hurts business prospects.
sentences.cn: 以上的电话交谈非但粗鲁, 亦损及商机.

sentences.en: These adjectives mean abrupt and sometimes discourteous in manner or speech.
sentences.cn: 这些形容词意为粗鲁,有时意为在行为或言语上无礼.

trans.tran_en: not polite, and not showing respect for other people
